SEARCH
Package executor.service.service.executor

Interface ScenarioExecutor

All Known Implementing Classes:
ScenarioExecutorService
public interface ScenarioExecutor
Interface defining the contract for executing scenarios using a WebDriver.

The ScenarioExecutor interface declares a method for executing scenarios with the given WebDriver instance. Implementations of this interface are responsible for interpreting and executing the steps defined within a Scenario using the provided WebDriver.

The single method, execute, takes a Scenario object representing the scenario to be executed and a WebDriver instance for interacting with the web application. The method returns a ScenarioResult object, capturing the result and outcome of the scenario execution.

Implementing classes are expected to provide logic for interpreting each step of the scenario and performing the necessary actions using the WebDriver. They should handle any errors or exceptions that may occur during scenario execution and report the result using the ScenarioResult object.

It is recommended to use this interface in conjunction with a scenario-driven testing framework, where scenarios are defined using Scenario objects, and the execution is carried out by classes implementing this interface.

See Also:

  • ScenarioResult
  • WebDriver

  • Method Details

    • execute

      ScenarioResult execute(Scenario scenario, org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver webDriver)
      Executes the given scenario using the provided WebDriver.

      The execute method is responsible for interpreting and executing the steps defined within the provided Scenario using the given WebDriver. It returns a ScenarioResult object, capturing the result and outcome of the scenario execution.

      The method takes two parameters:

      • scenario: The Scenario object representing the scenario to be executed. It contains the sequence of steps and associated data defining the behavior of the scenario.
      • webDriver: The WebDriver instance for interacting with the web application. This WebDriver is used to perform actions specified in the scenario, such as clicking elements, navigating between pages, or interacting with web elements.

      The implementation of this method should include logic to interpret each step of the scenario, perform the necessary actions using the WebDriver, handle any errors or exceptions that may occur during scenario execution, and report the result using the ScenarioResult object.

      It is recommended to use this method in conjunction with a scenario-driven testing framework, where scenarios are defined using Scenario objects, and their execution is carried out by classes implementing this interface.

      Parameters:
      scenario - The scenario to be executed.
      webDriver - The WebDriver instance for interacting with the web application.
      Returns:
      A ScenarioResult object representing the result of the scenario execution.
      See Also:
      • Scenario
      • ScenarioResult
      • WebDriver
